intro: Mimosa uribeana, commonly known as the Uribé mimosa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and showy, yellow flower clusters. The plant is typically shrub-like, with slender stems and can grow up to several meters in height. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
